zone.name: The Tower in the Wastes (1 of 2)

mobs.keywords: dragon blue young immature wasteland-mob young-blue-dragon
mobs.long_desc: An immature blue &4&bdragon&0 has made this place his home!
mobs.desc: The dragon is still quite, quite young, and thus he is not much larger than a buffalo, yet.  Large scales cover the back of the beast where it would be otherwise vulnerable.  The stomach and chest have smaller scales and would be more easily penetrated, if it weren't for those pesky teeth and claws that will likely stand in a potential attacker's way.  Curiously the dragon has a tuft of black hair right on the top of its head.

mobs.keywords: warrior armored tall female human wasteland-mob
mobs.long_desc: A tall, well built female human surveys the area.
mobs.desc: The human is tall, and fairly large.  She walks about confidently, surveying the area.  In one hand she holds a map, which she glances at when the chance arises.  On her belt is a loop where one might keep an axe, but it is currently empty .

mobs.keywords: mage half elf elven half-elven robes yellow wasteland-mob
mobs.long_desc: A half-elf wearing bright yellow robes searches through the rock for something.
mobs.desc: The half-elf's robes, being as bright as they are, catch your eye.  Amazingly, emblazoned on the robes in gold and copper is the visage of a copper sun, with golden rays extruding in all directions.  Somehow, even on the bright background, the sun seems to shine.

mobs.long_desc: A small gnome here is wearing white robes that blend in to the surroundings.
mobs.desc: The gnome wears a tight white outfit, including gloves, boots, and a hood.  He blends in to the surroundings quite nicely.

mobs.long_desc: A small gnome here is wearing white robes that blend in to the surroundings.
mobs.desc: The gnome wears a tight white outfit, including gloves, boots, a robe, and a hood.  The overall effect is that if you aren't looking at him, you probably won't notice him.  You catch a glimpse of a brown sheath under the robe, probably for holding a dagger, by the looks of it.

mobs.long_desc: A rugged dwarf roots through the rubble, looking for treasure.
mobs.desc: This dwarf is young, and is nervously picking through the rubble, keeping an eye out for danger.  His clothing seems fresh and new, except for the layer of white dust covering his legs.  He wears a helmet, but it looks like it's as much for show as for protection.

mobs.keywords: man silent one rocking wasteland-mob silent-one
mobs.long_desc: A man stands here rocking back and forth silently.
mobs.desc: The man has a vacant stare, and seems to be rocking back and forth silently. You notice a long triple gash across his abdomen, caked with blood.  His shirt is torn, giving evidence of a prior bloody confrontation.  Whatever it was, he seems to have survived, though worse for the wear.

mobs.long_desc: A scrawny dog is chained to a rock here, left to die.
mobs.desc: The dog was once a fine black animal, but it has been chained here to a rock. Though the chain is somewhat long, it is evident that the dog hasn't eaten well; its ribs show through its skin.  You do notice a bit of dried blood about its mouth.

mobs.long_desc: A large worm with rows of sharp teeth slinks out of a hole.
mobs.desc: This segmented worm has burrowed a home into this pit.  It pokes out of a hole beneath the bones lining the area, seeking fresh blood.  This worm peeks its head out of a hole under a pile of bones.  Its girth is such that it could probably swallow you whole, perhaps with a little stretching.  It seems to be excited by even the smallest movement.

mobs.keywords: vulture blood bloody beaked bloody-beaked wasteland-mob
mobs.long_desc: A vulture circles overhead, looking for carrion.
mobs.desc: The vulture circles overhead, almost within reach at times.  Its beak is stained red with fresh blood - something must have died recently.  Though it must have eaten recently, its hunger is evidently not sated, as it is waiting for you to become dinner.

mobs.keywords: rat large two headed two-headed wasteland-mob
mobs.long_desc: A large two headed rat scurries about, searching for edibles.
mobs.desc: The rat is the size of a small dog (not counting the second head), and yet is still as agile as any more normal rat.  Its brown fur is dusted with the white dust that coats the wasteland outside.  As it moves, it visibly shakes off some of the dust, but the dust never seems to hit the ground.

mobs.long_desc: A carpet of moss slithers across the ground towards whatever is moving the most.
mobs.desc: A carpet of sickly yellow moss covers part of the ground here.  The disturbing part is that the moss seems to have the ability to move about, and it is attracted to motion.

mobs.long_desc: A large male elk roams the grounds, seemingly lost.
mobs.desc: The elk seems to be confused, walking around aimlessly.  Occaisonally, the elk stops for a moment and sneezes.  Its brown, shaggy fur is grimy with a whitish mud.

mobs.long_desc: A halfling limps by, glancing around cautiously.
mobs.desc: The halfling is limping, keeping pressure off of his left leg, where, judging from the bloody bandage, he has sustained recent injury.  He appears to be going round to the various people in the area, striking up conversations.

mobs.keywords: demon being tall muscular demonic guardian wasteland-mob
mobs.long_desc: A large being stands to the east of the door, arms folded.
mobs.desc: The being stands tall, muscular arms folded across its chest.  Its red-brown skin looks almost black in the dark hallway.  In place of hair, a large beige horn takes up most of the top of its head, almost like a rams horns folded flat upon the head.

mobs.long_desc: A large being stands to the west of the door, arms folded.
mobs.desc: The being stands tall, muscular arms folded across its chest.  Its red-brown skin looks almost black in the dark hallway.  In place of hair, a large beige horn takes up most of the top of its head, almost like a rams horns folded flat upon the head.

mobs.long_desc: A large, human sized ant stands here, surveying the walls.
mobs.desc: The ant is larger than an average sized human, and looks quite weathered.  It carries a small hammer and a polishing cloth.

mobs.long_desc: An ant, standing as tall as a gnome, chisels away at the wall here.
mobs.desc: The ant stands as tall as a gnome, and has strong, if stringy, arms.  Its antannae are long but bend back behind the head, safely out of the way for increased work efficiency!

mobs.long_desc: A demon with its arms folded stands facing the west door.
mobs.desc: The demon is quite large, and successfully blocks most of the alcove.  Its form is not quite definite, as if it is made of smoke.  Its eyes focused to the west, on the door.

mobs.long_desc: A muscular barbarian in flowing robes sits behind the desk.
mobs.desc: Torik is large, even for a barbarian.  His hair is gray and coarse, with a gray beard to match.  His eyes seem bright, though tired.  Blue robes drape his body, nearly matching some of the veins in the marble.

mobs.long_desc: A dancing sword swings through the air, slicing imaginary foes to bits.
mobs.desc: The sword isn't very fancy - it is made of a dull metal.  Wrapped about the handle are strips of cloth, now slightly torn.  The sword swoops through the air, full of life.

mobs.long_desc: A woman effectively hides in the shadows here, almost escaping attention.
mobs.desc: The woman is wearing clothes befitting your average commoner, but something seems unusual about the way she hides in the shadows of the room.  Her features are nothing of note, or at least that seems to be what she wants.

mobs.long_desc: A man practices his swordplay against a hay filled dummy.
mobs.desc: Weaving and bobbing, it's hard to get a good look at him.  His unibrow eyebrow is the first feature that stands out.  He wears black trousers, but no shirt - his back muscles ripple as he practices various maneuvers.

mobs.keywords: elemental fire flame being living enormous creature wasteland-mob lord fire-elemental-lord
mobs.long_desc: An enormous creature of living flame is the obvious source of the heat!
mobs.desc: Its eyes are the blue flame of clean burning flame, in sharp contrast to the orange yellow glow of the rest of its "body".  Its form is indefinite, flowing and flickering.

mobs.long_desc: A worm, large enough to swallow a horse without effort, peeks out of a hole.
mobs.desc: The worm is colossal, peeking its head out of a hole large enough that a horse and rider could easily ride through.  Three rings of teeth glisten within the opening that must be its mouth.  It moves slowly but deliberately, in no particular hurry.

mobs.long_desc: A shapely demoness in a tight black outfit smiles from behind the desk.
mobs.desc: The demoness wears a tight black outfight, showing off her shapely form.  Of course, being a demoness, the form is shapely because that is the physical form she has chosen to manifest.

mobs.long_desc: An enormous demon stares off into the swirling nothingness.
mobs.desc: The demon stands at least twice as tall as an average human.  His muscles ripple unnaturally as he stares into space.  He seems quite intent on watching the swirling patterns in the darkness, as though they have meaning.  He wears no shirt, but a pair of red trousers.  A pair of black horns curves back from his head, much as a deer's antlers.

mobs.keywords: gazebo undead white large frame flesh
mobs.long_desc: A large white gazebo stands here, its flesh rotting off its frame.
mobs.desc: It looks unfinished.

objects.ground: A shield shaped amulet here seems to have failed to protect its previous user.

extras.text: A polished silver and gold checkered shield is attached to a fine silver chain. The amulet is about the size of an eyeball, and shimmer faintly in the light.

objects.ground: A small, silvery key glints in the light.

extras.text: The makeshift rope belt has a small knot on one side, whereupon a key is tied to the belt.  The key is made of a silver, which has dulled with age.

objects.ground: A warhammer made of a flaky white stone rests here.

extras.text: A fine armament, the head of the warhammer is a large piece of cylindrical white stone.  The head is attached to a thick rod of metal the handle is wrapped in wide leather strips.

objects.ground: A pair of gloves with long, sharp blades lies here.

extras.text: The gloves each feature 3 long blades originating from the top of the hand. When wielding a weapon or making a fist, the long blades extend past the hand, making it more difficult to block a blow without taking damage.  The blades seem to be connected to a large metal plate sandwiched between two layers of leather.  A wide strap allows one to tighten the whole apparatus to the hand for stability.

objects.ground: A trapezoidal stone lies here on the ground.

extras.text: The stone is basically trapezoidal, but the parallel sides are rounded, as if it were cut out of a circle.

objects.ground: The circle of runestones is glowing green, showing another room within.

extras.text: Thirteen stones lie in a circle about a depression in the ground.  A green field of energy flows across the entirety, showing a very green depiction of another (very green) room.

objects.ground: A lone green book lies on the bookshelf on the north wall.

extras.text: The title of the book is "Muscipul yn Perfidi".

objects.ground: A stone chest is built in to the corner of the wall here.

extras.text: In the corner, a rectangular chest is built into the wall.  The top of the chest opens outward, away from the wall, and is mostly flat.

objects.ground: A brown scroll lying on the ground is bound with plain twine.

extras.text: The scroll is made of delicate brown paper, and has been rolled into a tube. The tube has been tied together with a single piece of brown twine.

objects.ground: A yellow-tinged, fist-shaped crystal lies here, its purpose forgotten.
objects.action_desc: The fist pulses with energy, and soars through the air.

extras.text: The crystal is a sickly yellow, and has been carved into a clenched fist, with part of the forearm intact.

objects.ground: A square, wooden shield sits here, waiting to protect someone new.

extras.text: The shield is a simple shield, consisting of three layers of wooden planks in alternating directions, with horizontal banding across the lot.  Crude, but effective.

objects.ground: A steel battle-axe rests here, its nicks and scratches showing its veteran status.

extras.text: The blade on this heavy steel axe is small, but deadly sharp.  The blade end of the axe is weighted, although overall the weapon is quite light.

objects.ground: A pile of interconnecting rings lie here in a heap.

extras.text: Although not very good against piercing or bludgeoning weapons, this light weight armor is fairly effective against slashing type weapons.  The armor seems to be in fair condition - quite worn, but still usable.

objects.ground: The skeleton of a dragon long since dead rests in a depression in the ground here.

extras.text: The bones are large, some of the ribs as girthy as your arm.  The dragon has long since been dead, as no flesh is left on the bones.  From the depth of the depression around the bones, it looks like it was struck down from the air,

objects.ground: A heavy rope dangles from the ceiling here, with a stone attached to the end.
A glowing plant in a pot grows before your eyes.

extras.text: Inside a simple stone pot is a leafy green plant, which happens to be glowing brightly.

objects.ground: The unnatural glow of a tuber of some sort is visible beneath the dirt of a pot.

extras.text: Beneath the layer of dark soil at the top of the pot, is obviously a tuber of some sort - even through the dirt, its glow visible.  Disturbing.

objects.ground: An ornate longsword, more of an heirloom than a weapon, lies here.

extras.text: While the fancy swirling hilt and pommel are quite nice to look at, it doesn't help the usability of the weapon any.

objects.ground: A circle of stones emanates a swirling green field - perhaps a portal.

extras.text: Thirteen stones lie in a circle about a depression in the ground.  A green field of energy flows across the entirety, showing a very green depiction of another (very green) room.

objects.ground: A silver, two-handed bastard sword seems to reflect its surroundings.

extras.text: A fine sword, this bastard sword's blade and hilt are finely polished silver. The handle on the blade is made of a hard dark stained wood.

objects.ground: A silver-trimmed leather spellbook lies open, face down.

extras.text: The leather is pale grey, very supple, and thin.  The silver trim is painted on in long, quick strokes.  No symbols or drawings adorn the spine or cover; only faint wrinkles criscross the leather.

objects.ground: A field of glowing red covers the tunnel to the west.

extras.text: An amorphous blob of swirling red seems to be enveloping the tunnel entrance to the west.

objects.ground: A glowing blue field protects the tunnel to the east.

extras.text: An amorphous blob of swirling blue energy seals the tunnel entrance to the east.

objects.ground: A blue kite shield lies here, collecting dust.

extras.text: The shield is painted a bright blue, with silver trim about the edges.  The shield once held a crest of some sort, but all that is left are a few specks of silver and gold here and there.

objects.ground: A bright yellow scroll faintly glows with energy.
The third stair from the top seems to be loose!

extras.text: The third step seems to be fake its marble top is loose, and with a little effort, it looks as though it could be removed, concealing something below.

objects.ground: A red gem lies here, dull but clear.

extras.text: The ruby is approximately the size of a fist, and has so many facets that from a distance, it almost looks spherical.  Yellow flickers of light occaisonally eminate from within the stone.

objects.ground: A steel sword with a cloth wrapped handle lies here.

extras.text: The sword isn't very fancy - it is made of a dull metal, and strips of cloth are wrapped about the handle.  Occaisonally, the sword seems to twitch; it must be a trick of the light.

objects.ground: An enormous steel chest rests upon the stone pillar.

extras.text: Atop the pillar lies a quite large steel chest.  It looks large enough to hold a suit of armor, or a pony, or any number of other items.  On the front of the chest is a large protrusion with a key hole, where the top of the chest locks in.

objects.ground: A glass case rests against the northern wall.

extras.text: A simple case, the frame is made of a dark, almost black wood.  The walls are glass, and the front has a hinge, but no door.

objects.ground: A dagger with a gold foil handle and sapphire studs lies here, out of place.

extras.text: The rough steel blade of this dagger does no justice to its overall beauty. The handle has been foiled in gold leaf, with 8 small sapphires ringing the top.

objects.ground: A key, carved from marble, lies here.
A leatherbound book lies here, no title visible.

extras.text: 9th day of the Month of Discovery, 352 If your reading this, well, the plans didn't go off correctly.  I wanted a legacy to carry on.  This tower was to be it.  In my days, I saw many places, full of traps and treachery, but also of wealth and other spoils.  I strived to leave such a place myself.  Alas, I plan on destroying these notes when it is done, thus if you are reading this, the tower is not.  As I write this, the enchanted tower has been completed ; a grand four stories tall.  It's too bad I will be destroying part of it soon.  . . Work will not be finished for months, I fear, and with my ailing health, I may not live to see it done.  I've called upon many favors - I'm afraid even my soul will be the cost in the end.  So far, there's not much loot in here, most has been sold for the protectors of the castle.  Sweet irony. In the end, I have turned to demons to protect the lair, and slave labor to build it.  What have I become.  Perhaps this is what is truly killing me.  Tis only luck that the blue dragon has made the tower his perch.  What would it cost for such a guardian? The writing continues in part2, part3, part4, part5, part6, part7

First, I ask myself, why am I building this tower?  I have adventured for many years, and have always been fascinated by places I had gone, both in the architecture, and the secrets held within.  I have decided to leave a legacy behind me.  Someone has to die for a tomb to be looted. Alas, with a life of adventure came a life with no heirs, so my money is worthless after I die anyhow.  I am still in good health now, but getting older every day.  Thus, my life's goal. I have enlisted a few of my more mystical friends for the construction. This shall be no ordinary tower, by any means.  For one, we have concocted an enchantment for the stone of the tower, such that it shall rebuild itself if e'er it gets destroyed.  The bits of stone are attacted to one another, such that no matter the distance, they will slowly be pulled together again.  Yea, it may take millenia if they are far apart, but the tower shall never be destroyed.

This was quite costly, but I believe it will be a good investment in the long run.  No matter what happens, the tower will never quite die. The basement has been created.  We decided upon an infinite hallway to protect my study.  It too wasn't terribly hard to create, merely a modified dimension door spell.  I had to give up my grandmother's broach, though, to get the work done.  My friends are quite stingy, they are. Finding workers from an area far enough away that they won't be able to find their way back was quite tough.  The southern continent was a good choice.  To get back without help, they'd have to raft the blue fog sea.  I've ne'er seen a bigger ship down there in my days.  Getting them back there will be tougher. Our ride got called off to tend to her father, dying of old age.

Had the druid community not severed ties with me after the unfortunate incident in the forest...  I hadn't honestly meant to hurt anything, especially not the animals, and how was I to know that the owl was a shapechanger... Life would be much easier. We just had a few incidents in the construction.  The sub basement floor collapsed.  It turns out a giant worm has burrowed under the tower.  It turns out to have some intelligence, I think.  I... agreed to keep it fed if it did no damage.  I didn't realize how much it eats.  We may need to exterminate it. Some fool put a door on the second floor of the tower to the outside. Unfortunately, they're nothing outside of it.  I've locked it to avoid any more accidents.  Two deaths were bad enough.  Perhaps they would have survived, but evidently the door happened to lead right above where the worm had burrowed, thus the pit was quite deep.

Part of our labor force has decided to abandon the project.  A few of them...  Were threatening to break their vow.  I had to put them down.  I think the rest will understand the graveness of the situation, and will realize the penalties for betraying me. The work force has mutinied.  After hearing tales of what I did to those that left, they snuck out after I offered them a two day break.  I will track them down one by one and punish them all.  Traitors.  First, though, I must find a replacement work force...  Work most continue - the tower must be completed I have taken ill as of late, quite severely.  I hope it will pass, but I must press on in case it does not.  I am ...  Seeking connections at the moment. I have sought an audience with the Demon Lord Krisenna.  We have struck a deal; he seems quite benevolent at the moment.  Hopefully it will stay that way.  The deal works in both our favors.  They provide the workers and protection, and I provide them with a safe entry way into our world.  They have finished the external tower, and have retreated into the bowels to finish up.

I have allowed them free reign to create themselves a sealed off passageway to keep anyone who might make their way in from getting to them.  I am not even allowed to see what they are doing there, lest I bother them, or give others knowledge of how to do the same thing.

I have just stumbled back across this book, and it weighs heavily on my mind.  I have seen my soul blacken over time.  Alas, I think it is too late for me.  They have taken almost all of my goods as tribute, and they have an iron grip on the tower.  I plot, hoping to find a way to get rid of them, but I fear the deal is done.

objects.ground: An ash wand gives off wisps of dark smoke.

extras.text: The ash wand is blackened near its tip, and wisps of smoke curl from that end. The wand is warm to the touch, but not hot enough to be painful.

objects.ground: A dagger with a thin, spiralling blade rests here.

extras.text: This is a simple dagger, except for the blade.  The dagger's blade spirals toward the tip, creating two full revolutions.  A skilled hand could do awful things with this blade.

objects.ground: An old-fashion longsword here waits, ready for action.
Here lies a small, sapphire-tipped key.
A set of fine scalemail lies in a rigid heap.

extras.text: If the scales on this set of scalemail look familiar, perhaps it is because a master crafstman painstakingly craft each one to resemble one of the scales of the great black dragon, Sagece.  The scales must have been gathered during a successful (meaning only several deaths to the party) assault upon her.  Or perhaps the beauty of the piece of armor just provides motivation for creative daydreaming.

objects.ground: A black ring with golden runes engraved about it is caked in dirt.

extras.text: The ring is made of a ring of black stone, with miniature gold runes inscribed about the outside.  The ring itself smells like burning flesh, but throbs with magical energy.

objects.ground: A hammer designed to chip away at rock lies here.
A gray dragon lies crouched in the midst of the hallway.

extras.text: Looking at the dragon, the fire in its eyes is visible.  Literally.  Upon a second glance, the stony armor plating reveals itself to be. . . stone.  It's a giant statue, and something inside it seems to be burning.

objects.ground: Flame flickers in the shape of a key.

extras.text: The flame seems to flicker about the vague shape of a key.  It seems to keep a fairly solid form, although the flame dances.

objects.ground: A key of gray stone lies here.
The image of a demon wavers here,  mouth open wide enough for you to enter.

extras.text: The giant floating image looks like the head of a powerful demon.  It's exceedingly ugly.  Most of it is transparent, but the giant mouth - large enough to walk through - surrounds an opaque, black, swirling mist.  It looks as though it might lead somewhere, though whether it would be wise to enter is another question entirely.

objects.ground: A leather pouch full of money lies on the ground.

extras.text: A small leather pouch lies on the ground.  The leather tie-strap is untied, and the glint of gold and silver within is visible.

objects.ground: A pitch black morning star lies here collecting dust.

extras.text: The morning star is pitch black, absorbing all available light.  The ball is large and quite hefty, and the handle is quite sturdy.  A fine weapon overall.

objects.ground: A key made from the flesh of some unfortunate soul rots here.
A single lens lies on the ground, scratched up.
A plant with feathery yellow-green flowers basks in the light.

extras.text: A single stalk of dill, complete with a fist sized umbrel of yellow-green flowers, grows in a small earthen pot.  Basking in the unnatural glow of the room has benefitted the plant, which has a strong aroma.  The stalk seems to be in good condition, nearly ready for harvesting of its oil.

objects.ground: A flickering torch burns to the north, illuminating the area faintly.

extras.text: The torch is a simple branch with an oil soaked rag wrapped around the top.  The flame burns unevenly and flickers and dances.

objects.ground: A single cracked horn lies here, wrenched from the skull of a demon.

extras.text: This lone horn is very large and curved.  It is cracked and broken in two places: a large break marks the spot where it was wrenched from the mighty demon Krisenna's head, and a smaller break is higher up.  The smaller end is worn, as if the horns were smoothed after the injury.  Whether this was done in battle or for vanity is impossible to tell.  Some power remains in the horn, damaged as it is.

triggers.name: Bloodworm_attack
triggers.commands: * Basically, let them stew in the pit for a little bit before they get whacked. if %actor.level% < 100 wait 14s kill %actor.name% endif

triggers.name: Ring_Bell
triggers.commands: if %arg% /= rope wsend %actor% As you pull the rope, you think you hear the faint ringing of a bell. wechoaround %actor% As %actor.name% pulls the rope, you seem to hear a bell ringing. if %get.obj_count[12521]% || %get.obj_count[12522]% wat 12602 wpurge field endif if %get.obj_count[12521]% || %get.obj_count[12522]% wat 12602 wpurge field endif wat 12602 wload obj 12521 wat 12602 wload obj 12522 wat 12602 wecho The echo of a bell ringing echoes through the cavern. wat 12602 wecho In response, glowing fields envelope the tunnel entrances to the west and east. else return 0 endif

triggers.name: Slam_door_trigger
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == -1 wait 2s wecho The door slams shut with a loud click! wdoor 12533 east flags abcde wdoor 12534 west flags abcd endif

triggers.name: brother
triggers.commands: switch %actor.quest_stage[krisenna_quest]% case 0 case 1 wait 1s mecho %self.name% says, 'Our father warned him not to go... But he wouldn't mecho &0listen.' wait 2s say Now he's probably dead... wait 1s emote starts bawling like a baby. wait 3s emote sobs, 'You've got to find him!!  Will you find him?' break case 2 wait 1 s say He's dead??  Oh no! wait 2 s cry wait 2 s emote dries his tears on his bloodstained sleeve. wait 1 s mecho %self.name% says, 'He carried our grandfather's warhammer.  The mecho &0warhammer is very precious to my family.  Would you please find it? mecho &0I will reward you as best I can!' break default wait 1 s mecho %self.name% says, 'He was very dear to me... foolhardy, but a good mecho &0brother.' done

triggers.name: Drop_rune
triggers.commands: if (%object.vnum% == 12504) wait 1 wpurge %object% wait 5 wecho The runestone flares green as it falls into place. wait 1s wecho As the stone settles, a field of green energy spreads across the circle of stones. wload obj 12505 wait 1s endif

triggers.name: Trapped
triggers.commands: wait 1s say They say the key is at the top of the tower. Watch your step though... wait 2s say When I tried, I fell through the floor, spraining my ankle. wait 2s say If you could free my brother, my family would be quite thankful. wait 2s msend %actor.name% %self.name% looks at you pleadingly. mechoaround %actor% %self.name% looks at %actor.name% pleadingly.

triggers.name: Get_Book
triggers.commands: odamage %actor% 100 slash if %damdone% == 0 return 1 else return 0 osend %actor% As you grab the book, blades rip through your hand - it must have been trapped! (&3&b%damdone%&0) oechoaround %actor% %actor.name% grabs the green book, and screams in pain as blades rip through %actor.p% hand. (&3&b%damdone%&0) end

triggers.name: Fall_into_pit
triggers.commands: Nothing.

triggers.name: Statue_trigger
triggers.commands: wecho Blue crackles of lightning seem to crawl up the statues leg! wait 2s wecho Before your very eyes, the top of the leg glows blue, and starts to liquefy. wait 2s wecho The leg resolidifies, with more of the thigh than before intact!

triggers.name: Dragon Guards Chest
triggers.commands: msend %actor.name% As you reach towards the chest, %self.name% swipes at you, forestalling the attempt! mechoaround %actor.name% %self.name% guards the chest as %actor.name% approaches it.

triggers.name: Unused trigger?
triggers.commands: oexp %actor% -100000 osend %actor.name% As you grab the fist, you feel a slight jolt, and feel your life force being drained.

triggers.name: injured halfling speech start
triggers.argument_list: hi hello hi? hello? progress progress? status status?
triggers.commands: switch %actor.quest_stage[krisenna_quest]% case 0 wait 1s emote looks panicked. wait 1s say You've got to help me... break case 1 wait 1 s mecho %self.name% says, 'Have you found my brother yet?  He must be in the mecho &0tower somewhere!' break case 2 wait 1 s say He's dead??  Oh no! wait 2 s cry wait 2 s emote dries his tears on his bloodstained sleeve. wait 1 s mecho %self.name% says, 'He carried our grandfather's warhammer.  The mecho &0warhammer is very precious to my family. rooms.name: Northern Border of the Wasteland
rooms.description: With the haze that permeates the area, it is hard to see too far to the south.  To the north, however, a large black cliff is clearly visible.  The cliff rises into the fog as high as is visible, making it nearly impossible for any light to filter through from the sky.  Though hazy, the air is quite dry and dusty.  The ground is littered with fist sized chunks of rough white marble, as well as a fine white powder, probably from the same source.  The clearing continues to the east and south.

rooms.name: Northeastern Watchroom
rooms.description: A small room is set somewhat high in the cliff here.  Large windows of rough, dark glass are set into the southern and western walls, blending in to the cliffs, and allowing an observer in the room to look out upon the wastes without being noticed.  A layer of dust upon the floor seems relatively untouched, and the air seems stale, suggesting that the room had not been opened in quite a while.  There seems to be only the one exit to the west.

rooms.name: The Great Hall
rooms.description: The stairs open up into a great hall, which extends to the south and east. Four evenly spaced pillars support the next floor, or rather what's left of it. The sky, or rather the gray haze, is visible through a gaping hole in the ceiling to the east.  For that matter, it is visible at the top of the wall to the west, where it seems a chunk of rock has been destroyed.  Three large windows are set in the south wall, each with a set of stone shutters which are, at the moment, open.

rooms.name: Western Border of the Wasteland
rooms.description: With the haze that permeates the area, it is hard to see too far to the east.  To the west, however, a large black cliff is clearly visible.  The cliff rises into the fog as high as is visible, making it nearly impossible for any light to filter through from the sky.  Though hazy, the air is quite dry and dusty.  The ground is littered with fist sized chunks of rough white marble, as well as a fine white powder, probably from the same source.  The clearing continues to the east and south.

rooms.description: With the haze that permeates the area, it is hard to see too far to the south.  To the north, however, a large black cliff is clearly visible.  The cliff rises into the fog as high as is visible, making it nearly impossible for any light to filter through from the sky.  Though hazy, the air is quite dry and dusty.  The ground is littered with fist sized chunks of rough white marble, as well as a fine white powder, probably from the same source.  The clearing continues to the north, west, east, and south.

rooms.name: North of the Tower
rooms.description: The haze is a good deal thicker towards the north than to the south, where a tower is barely visible.  From here, little detail about the tower is actually actually discernable, except that the tower is at least two stories tall.  To the north, the cliffs are also faintly visible through the haze.  Various chunks of white marble are strewn about, ranging from human size blocks to pebbles, to a fine white dust that seems to cover most everything.  The wasteland extends in all directions.

rooms.name: The Great Hall
rooms.description: The hall continues to the north, where a staircase descends to the ground floor of the tower.  To the east, the hall continues along the southern wall. From here, part of the wasteland surrounding the tower is visible, including what appears to be a trail leading to the east.  The shutters on the window are made of stone, and open outward; in their open state, it is hard to get a grip on them, and their heft makes it difficult to close them.

From here, it seems as though the northeast part of the tower is taller than the southwest; it looks as though something has destroyed part of the tower.  To the west, the cliffs are also faintly visible through the haze.  Various chunks of white marble are strewn about, ranging from human size blocks to pebbles, to a fine white dust that seems to cover most everything.  The wasteland extends in all directions.

rooms.name: North of the Tower
rooms.description: The haze is a good deal thicker towards the north than to the south, where a tower is barely visible.  From here, little detail about the tower is actually discernable, except that the tower is at least two stories tall.  To the north, the cliffs are also faintly visible through the haze.  Various chunks of white marble are strewn about, ranging from human size blocks to pebbles, to a fine white dust that seems to cover most everything.  The wasteland extends in all directions.

rooms.name: North of the Tower
rooms.description: The tower looms above to the south.  The tower has a rounded rectangular base that slopes slightly inward as it goes up.  The walls are quite thick, and made of a highly polished white marble with sparse, bluish-black veins swirling throughout.  Oddly, in the immediate vicinity of the tower there is none of the dust characteristic of the area, nor the rock.  The haze is so scant here, that it almost seems to be gone; however, the apex of the tower is still blurry. Looking back to the north, it is impossible to see anything in the dense haze farther from the tower.  The courtyard continues in all directions except for the south.

rooms.name: Above a Pit
rooms.description: The tower looms above to the south.  The tower has a rounded rectangular base that slopes slightly inward as it goes up.  The walls are quite thick, and made of a highly polished white marble with sparse, bluish-black veins swirling throughout.  Oddly, in the immediate vicinity of the tower there is none of the dust characteristic of the area, nor the rock.  For that matter, there is no floor!  A large portion of this area is an entrance to a large pit!  The wastes extend to the north, west, and east, and obviously there is a pit below.

rooms.name: Northern Border of the Wasteland

The ground is littered with fist sized chunks of rough white marble, as well as a fine white powder, probably from the same source.  The clearing continues to the north, west, east, and south.

The ceiling above is nonexistant.  Evidently, this is the last floor of the tower that is intact.  The gray haze of the sky outside blends with with the swirl in the marble of whats left of the ceiling nicely.  A doorway, now devoid of door, is set in the northern wall.

rooms.name: A Strange Laboratory
rooms.description: This room is half laboratory, and half torture chamber.  The northern portion of the room is dominated by a large glass appartus full of various colored liquids, while the southern half has several sets of manacles attached to the walls.  Several burnt out torches line the room, most dense to the north.  With no windows in the room, almost no light filters in from the outside world.

rooms.name: The End of the Hall
rooms.description: The hallway ends with doors leading to your east and west.  A greenish-brown discoloartion stains the floor around the door to the east, as if a liquid had oozed it way out of the room.  The door to the west seems rather odd, as it is made of stone, unlike the other doors in the area, which are made of wood. The hallway leads back to the south.

West.description: A stone door is set into the wall to the west.

extras.text: The door is a single block seemingly carved from the wall mass itself.  Three protrusions extend from the door into the wall, and in the cracks between the protrusions and the wall, a stone rod goes through the protrusions and the wall, forming a giant stone hinge. (No pun intended)
There are fourteen stones set in a circle.  Each stone has a rune carved out of it, filled with gold.

rooms.name: An Indoor Garden
rooms.description: The ceiling of this room glows unnaturally, giving off a warm, gentle light. Rows of tables have various fruits and vegetables growing from within pots of glowing liquid.  The fact that the plants themselves are glowing might begin to explain why they haven't been looted.  The only exit appears to be to the west, through the door.

extras.text: The writing says, "Jelos was here, 2002".
There seems to be some writing on the pillar, although it is hard to make out.

rooms.name: A Spiral Staircase
rooms.description: A spiral staircase starts to the west, and heads up to the next floor of the tower.  The staircase seems to be one solid piece of stone; More amazingly, it seems to be part of the same rock that makes up the floor.  The banister has no support posts besides at the bottom and top of the staircase.  However, even without other support, the rail seems quite stable, as it too, seems to be carved out of the same chunk of rock.

rooms.name: An Intersection of Hallways
rooms.description: Here, two hallways intersect, giving the option of going north, south, east, or west.  To the west, a spiral staircase rises to the next level.  To the north and south, the hallway leads to doors on either side.  To the east, the hallway dead ends.

rooms.name: The End of the Hall
rooms.description: The hallway comes to an end here, with no apparant doors or other exits.  A wide circle is inset in the ground, with around a dozen stones surrounding it. Other than that, there is nothing of note at this end of the hallway, other than a window set in the east wall, looking out into the wasteland.

extras.text: A full circle is depressed in the in the ground.  Twelve trapezoidal stones are spaced evenly about the circle, with a thirteenth spot open.  Each of the stones has an rune carved into it, and filled with gold.

Although the ceiling above you is intact, the ceiling to your west seems to be entirely destroyed.  The ceiling above looks to be in rather good shape, and gives no indications as to what happened to the rest of that floor.

rooms.name: A Library
rooms.description: A large stone table occupies the center of the room.  The flat, polished surface would make an excellent surface to study or plan.  Shallow shelves are carved into every wall, perfect for storing books.  Scraps of paper litter the floor from books that were deemed worthless during prior raids.

rooms.name: A Hallway
rooms.description: In stark contrast to the world outside, the inside of the tower seems to be in good shape.  The structure seems relatively unscathed, and no rocks are dust have made their way into the tower, which make the tower much more inhabitable than the outlying area.  The walls in the tower are highly polished, and though the floor is somewhat worn, it is still in good condition.  The hallway continues to the north, and the outside door hangs off of its hinge to the south.

South.description: The eastern door hangs off of its lower hinge, its upper hinge totally gone. The western door is nowhere to be seen.  /fi

rooms.name: A Storage Room
rooms.description: There is barely enough room here to maneuver through the shelves that line the walls.  Nothing of value is left, long since picked clean by looters, but various bits of glass and powder dust the room.  The walls are windowless, presumably to keep sunlight away from whatever was stored on the shelves.

rooms.name: Entrance to the Tower
rooms.description: A small entryway protrudes from the tower here.  A ceiling hangs overhead, spanning between the tower itself, and a wall to the south.  The entire structure seems to be made of the same white marble as the tower itself in fact, you can see no seam where the tower itself ends, and the ceiling or wall begins.  The enclosure would ostensibly provide shelter for visitors waiting to be let in.  A set of double doors are the main entrance to the tower.  Well, now there is only one door, and it is hanging off of its bottom hinge.  It looks as though the hinge has rusted into solidity, perhaps explaining why the door is still there.  The entry continues into the tower to the north, and the wasteland opens up to the east and west.

North.description: A single door, hanging off of its hinge, fails to bar your way into the tower.

Guards from the guardroom to the east would have manned the door, keeping the riffraff out, while allowing esteemed guests passage to the stairway to the west, as well as a rotting wooden door to the north.

North.description: A rotting wooden door is set into a stone doorway in the north wall of the tower.

rooms.name: Southern Border of the Wasteland
rooms.description: With the haze that permeates the area, it is hard to see too far to the north.  To the south, however, a large black cliff is clearly visible.  The cliff rises into the fog as high as is visible, making it nearly impossible for any light to filter through from the sky.  Though hazy, the air is quite dry and dusty.  The ground is littered with fist sized chunks of rough white marble, as well as a fine white powder, probably from the same source.  The clearing continues to the north and east

rooms.name: Southern Border of the Wasteland
rooms.description: With the haze that permeates the area, it is hard to see too far to the north.  To the south, however, a large black cliff is clearly visible.  The cliff rises into the fog as high as is visible, making it nearly impossible for any light to filter through from the sky.  Though hazy, the air is quite dry and dusty.  The ground is littered with fist sized chunks of rough white marble, as well as a fine white powder, probably from the same source.  The clearing continues to the north, west, and east.

rooms.name: Southern Border of the Wasteland
rooms.description: With the haze that permeates the area, it is hard to see too far to the north.  To the south, however, a large black cliff is clearly visible.  The cliff rises into the fog as high as is visible, making it nearly impossible for any light to filter through from the sky.  Though hazy, the air is quite dry and dusty.  The ground is littered with fist sized chunks of rough white marble, as well as a fine white powder, probably from the same source.  The clearing continues to the north, west, and east.

rooms.name: A Trail Through the Wastelands
rooms.description: With the haze that permeates the area, it is hard to see too far to the north.  To the south, however, a large black cliff is clearly visible.  The cliff rises into the fog as high as is visible, making it nearly impossible for any light to filter through from the sky.  Though hazy, the air is quite dry and dusty.  The ground is littered with fist sized chunks of rough white marble, as well as a fine white powder, probably from the same source.  The clearing continues to the east and west, and the trail continues to the north and south.

rooms.name: Southern Border of the Wasteland
rooms.description: With the haze that permeates the area, it is hard to see too far to the north.  To the south, however, a large black cliff is clearly visible.  The cliff rises into the fog as high as is visible, making it nearly impossible for any light to filter through from the sky.  Though hazy, the air is quite dry and dusty.  The ground is littered with fist sized chunks of rough white marble, as well as a fine white powder, probably from the same source.  The clearing continues to the north and west.  A large boulder resting against the cliffs blocks the way east.

rooms.name: Inside a False Boulder
rooms.description: The inside of the boulder has been polished to a fair degree.  Other than the exit door, the only portals to the outside are two peepholes set in the west wall.  It looks as though the holes are hidden in the shadow of an outcropping of the rock on the outside.  The holes' views are limited to almost nothing thanks to the haze, but based on the proximity to the end of the trail, it is likely that it was likely a concealed guard post overlooking the trail. The only exit is the opening in the wall to the east.

rooms.name: Southern Border of the Wasteland
rooms.description: With the haze that permeates the area, it is hard to see too far to the north.  To the south, however, a large black cliff is clearly visible.  The cliff rises into the fog as high as is visible, making it nearly impossible for any light to filter through from the sky.  Though hazy, the air is quite dry and dusty.  The ground is littered with fist sized chunks of rough white marble, as well as a fine white powder, probably from the same source.  The clearing continues to the north.  A large boulder blocks progress to the west.

rooms.name: Hovering Between the Pillars
rooms.description: There are tall stone pillars to the east and west.  The remnants of an arch jut inward, but the floor (ceiling?  ) they once carried has long fallen.  A floor is a few feet below.

rooms.name: A Guardroom
rooms.description: This guardroom is quite large, providing ample space for at least half a dozen guards to lounge during the quiet times.  The guardroom overlooks the antechamber leading to the stairs to the third floor, seperating the more public second floor from the higher floors.  Two large bedframes still sit in the eastern portion of the room, presumably to keep the guards close to where they're needed, but keep them fresh.  The only exit is the door to the west.

rooms.name: Trail Through the Mountains
rooms.description: The trail continues to the south towards the tunnel, and towards a large clearing to the north.  From here, it is nearly impossible to make out any detail about the clearing, as a light gray haze permeates the air, reducing visibility to nearly nothing.

rooms.name: Tunnel Opening
rooms.description: The tunnel and trail meets here.  Several sets of footprints lead out the tunnel to the north, through a narrow trail in the mountain.  The tunnel opens to the south, leading back in to the darkness.  The trail is littered with small white rocks, which stand out against the black rock foundation.

rooms.name: Tunnel Through the Mountain
rooms.description: The tunnel takes a sharp bend from the south to the east.  The white rock that lines the tunnel to the east and south seems to be missing here.  Light dances across the floor to the east the tunnel must have another opening.  The footprints of several visitors head towards the east.

rooms.name: Tunnel Through the Mountain
rooms.description: The tunnel is quite cramped, forcing careful motion to navigate through it. The path is still visible to the south, but the tunnel continues in to the darkness to the north.  Oddly, amongst the black rock that makes up the tunnel, there are bits of white rock on the floor here.

rooms.name: AI Room
rooms.description: You are in an unfinished room.

rooms.name: High Above a Large Pit
rooms.description: A small wooden door rots in its hinges, set in the northern wall of the tower, to the south.  A hole is set in the ground directly below.  Ahh.  The feeling of flight.  It -is- controlled flight, isn't it?

South.description: A rotting wood door is set into the a doorway in the northern wall of the tower.

rooms.name: A Large Pit
rooms.description: Whether this is a trap or a refuse pit is uncertain.  Bones of various creatures - from an unlucky adventurer to the bones of a pack animal who has tread its last mile - litter the pit.  A quick survey for escape routes yields nothing.  The entrance to the pit is actually quite smaller than the ceiling itself, which makes climbing out of the question.  The tower wall extends down below the floor of the pit, a full story's height deep.  The only apparent exit is the entrance to the pit, above.

North.description: It looks like the side of the pit is rough enough to climb to the north.

rooms.name: A Crumbling Lair
rooms.description: The northern and eastern walls here are still intact, as well as most of the ceiling above them.  To the south, however, the ceiling has collapsed, forming a wall of rubble.  The acrid smell of burnt flesh hangs in the air, as though this is someone's, or something's, dining room.  The west offers the only escape, but there is clearly no floor there.  Tread lightly.

rooms.name: Precarious Walkway
rooms.description: From here, the second floor of the tower is quite visible, since most of the floor below is missing.  Only a narrow path across the top of a crumbling arch remains.  To the west is a sturdier floor, held up, apparently, by one of the pillars on the second floor.  Across that floor is a set of stairs, offering a safe way back to the second floor.  Straight down also offers a way to the second floor, although not quite so safe.  To the east, another mass of floor is supported by another pillar.

rooms.name: The Top of the Crumbling Tower
rooms.description: Between the outer wall and the pillars of the floor below, this floor seems to be intact.  To the east however, a rift seems to seperate this portion of the floor from the eastern portion, which seems to also be intact.  Perhaps, at a run, the jump could be made to the other side?  There's only one way to know for sure.  From here, it is plain to see that the tower would be nearly invisble to anything with an aerial perspective.  The haze is thinner in the higher atmosphere, and the cliffs that surround the tower are visible.  The cliffs provide natural protection for the tower providing only the one access route from the ground, making the tower's location quite advantageous.
